parameters.name: imageRecipeArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe that you want to retrieve.

nested_items.name: requestId
nested_items.description: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

nested_items.name: imageRecipe
nested_items.description: The image recipe object.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: Specifies which type of image is created by the recipe - an AMI or a container image.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: platform
nested_items.description: The platform of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The owner of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: components
nested_items.description: The components that are included in the image recipe. Recipes require a minimum of one build component, and can have a maximum of 20 build and test components in any combination.

nested_items.name: componentArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

nested_items.name: parameters
nested_items.description: A group of parameter settings that Image Builder uses to configure the component for a specific recipe.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the component parameter to set.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: Sets the value for the named component parameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: parentImage
nested_items.description: The base image for customizations specified in the image recipe. You can specify the parent image using one of the following options:
AMI ID.
Image Builder image Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) Parameter Store Parameter, prefixed by ssm:, followed by the parameter name or ARN.
Amazon Web Services Marketplace product ID.

nested_items.name: blockDeviceMappings
nested_items.description: The block device mappings to apply when creating images from this recipe.

nested_items.name: deviceName
nested_items.description: The device to which these mappings apply.

nested_items.name: encrypted
nested_items.description: Use to configure device encryption.

nested_items.name: deleteOnTermination
nested_items.description: Use to configure delete on termination of the associated device.

nested_items.name: iops
nested_items.description: Use to configure device IOPS.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyId
nested_items.description: Use to configure the KMS key to use when encrypting the device.

nested_items.name: snapshotId
nested_items.description: The snapshot that defines the device contents.

nested_items.name: volumeSize
nested_items.description: Use to override the device's volume size.

nested_items.name: volumeType
nested_items.description: Use to override the device's volume type.

nested_items.name: throughput
nested_items.description: For GP3 volumes only --- The throughput in MiB/s that the volume supports.

nested_items.name: virtualName
nested_items.description: Use to manage instance ephemeral devices.

nested_items.name: noDevice
nested_items.description: Use to remove a mapping from the base image.

nested_items.name: dateCreated
nested_items.description: The date on which this image recipe was created.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: workingDirectory
nested_items.description: The working directory to be used during build and test workflows.

nested_items.name: additionalInstanceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Before you create a new AMI, Image Builder launches temporary Amazon EC2 instances to build and test your image configuration. Instance configuration adds a layer of control over those instances. You can define settings and add scripts to run when an instance is launched from your AMI.

nested_items.name: systemsManagerAgent
nested_items.description: Contains settings for the Systems Manager agent on your build instance.

nested_items.name: uninstallAfterBuild
nested_items.description: Controls whether the Systems Manager agent is removed from your final build image, prior to creating the new AMI. If this is set to true, then the agent is removed from the final image. If it's set to false, then the agent is left in, so that it is included in the new AMI. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: userDataOverride
nested_items.description: Use this property to provide commands or a command script to run when you launch your build instance.
